channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: StoryCorps' David Isay reacts to the Senate's vote to cut funding for public media
item.description: NPR's Steve Inskeep and Michel Martin speak with David Isay, founder and president of StoryCorps, about the Senate vote to cut funding for public broa...

item.title: Israel launches airstrikes on the Syrian capital of Damascus
item.description: Israel launched airstrikes Wednesday on Syria's capital of Damascus, saying it targeted the Syrian military headquarters and near the presidential pal...

item.title: Rescission package heads to final vote. And, Trump floats firing the Fed chairman
item.description: The Senate voted to approve a rescission package that claws back funds allocated for public media and foreign aid. And, President Trump floats the ide...

item.title: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The singer's life was touched by tragedies
item.description: 1960s pop star Connie Francis has died. The first female singer to chart a number-one single on the Billboard Hot 100, she sold over 40 million record...

item.title: Stand back! This explosive cucumber is bursting with seeds
item.description: A small, hairy, toxic version of the cucumbers found in the produce aisle does have an advantage over its more palatable cousins — a feat of ballistic...

item.title: Vir Das turns personal struggles into laughs in new comedy special
item.description: Award-winning comedian Vir Das joins "CBS Mornings Plus" to talk about his fifth Netflix special, "Fool Volume," which explores personal setbacks, los...

item.title: Families, kids most at risk of losing HUD housing with Trump’s proposed time limits
Ariana Grande says she's not abandoning music for film
item.description: The US singer insists there's still room for music after being cast in another film this week.

item.title: 1.4M of the nation’s poorest renters risk losing their homes with Trump’s proposed HUD time limit
item.description: A Trump administration proposal could put more than a million low-income households at risk of losing their government-subsidized housing.

item.title: What new summer spending data says about the economy
item.description: Jill Schlesinger explains what the new June retail and food sales data tells us about consumer habits and economic confidence.

item.title: Pope expresses sadness after Israeli strike on Gaza church kills three
item.description: Israel says it regrets any harm to a religious site or uninvolved civilians after a shell hits the Catholic Church of the Holy Family.

item.title: Sirens and evacuations as Taipei rehearses to counter China invasion threat
item.description: Taiwan's capital is holding one of its largest ever civil defence exercises.

item.title: Plans for direct train to Berlin in new UK-Germany treaty
item.description: It comes as Friedrich Merz makes his first official visit to the UK as German chancellor.

item.title: Deadly lightning strike in New Jersey
item.description: Children are among those injured after a sudden lightning strike in Jackson Township, New Jersey, according to officials. CBS News New York's Christin...

item.title: Iraq's shopping centre fire leaves 61 dead, many missing
item.description: Videos on social media appear to show a number of people on the roof during the fire in the city of Kut.

item.title: Former Eagles' LB Bryan Braman dies at 38 after cancer battle
item.description: Former Philadelphia Eagles linebacker Bryan Braman has died after a battle with a rare, aggressive form of cancer. He was 38.

item.title: Mark Zuckerberg settles lawsuit over Cambridge Analytica scandal, reports say
item.description: The reported settlement comes a day after an $8 billion class-action lawsuit began in court.

item.title: Camp Mystic leader may not have seen urgent alert before Texas flood, family spokesman says
